article: When Karen found another baby was on the way, she tried to help her 3-year-old son, Michael, prepare for a new _ And day after day, night after night, Michael _ to his sister in Mommy s stomach. The days _ by. The little girl got worse. The doctor said there was little hope. Be _ for the worst. Karen and her husband contacted a cemetery about a _ service. Michael, however, kept _ his parents to let him see his sister, I want to sing to her. However, kids are never allowed in Intensive Care. Karen decided to take Michael whether the hospital _ it or not. If he didn t see his sister right then, he may never see her _ She dressed him in an oversized operation suit and marched him into ICU. He looked like a walking laundry basket. The head nurse _ him as a child and shouted, Get that kid out of here now. No children are allowed. The mother rose up strong in Karen and the usually mild-mannered lady _ steel-eyed right into the head nurse s eyes, He is not leaving until he sings to his sister. After a moment, the 3-year-old began to sing: You are my sunshine, my only sunshine, you make me happy when skies are gray. Instantly the baby girl seemed to respond. The pulse rate became _ Keep on singing, Michael, encouraged Karen with _ in her eyes. You never know, dear, how much I love you, please don t take my sunshine away. As Michael sang to his sister, the baby s _ became smooth. The other night, dear, as I lay sleeping, I dreamed I held you in my _ . Michael s little sister began to relax. Keep singing, Michael. Tears covered the face of the bossy head nurse. You are my sunshine, my only sunshine. The next _ ....the very next day...the little girl was _ enough to go home.
